translated: why did you not make a proper connection even with the improper sandal tree?🔽Having a good root, spreading widely, with a shining shade, standing on the right path,

analyzed: sevyaḥ sadbhiḥ iti idam ākalayatā tāla udhvagena āśritaḥ
translated: to be served by the good - having understood this, the palm tree was resorted to by the traveler.

original: puṃsaḥ śaktiriyatyasau sa tu phaledadyāthavā śvothavā
analyzed: puṃsaḥ śaktiḥ iyatī asau sa tu phalet adya athavā śvas thavā
translated: This is the ability of a man, whether it bears fruit today or tomorrow,

original: kāle kvāpyathavā kadācidathavā netyatra vedhāḥ prabhuḥ //
analyzed: kāle kvāpi athavā kadācid athavā na iti atra vedhāḥ prabhuḥ
translated: The Creator is the Lord as to whether it is at the proper time or not, or whether it is ever or never.

analyzed: yat jātaḥ asi catuṣpathe ghana lasat chāyā usi kim chāyayā
translated: Since you are born at a crossroad, you have dense and shining shade, but what is the use of shade?

original: saṃyuktaḥ phalitosi kiṃ yadi phalaiḥ pūrṇosi kiṃ saṃnataḥ /
analyzed: saṃyuktaḥ phalitaḥ asi kim yadi phalaiḥ pūrṇaḥ asi kim saṃnataḥ
translated: You are united with fruits, but what if you have fruits? You are full, but what if you are bent down?

original: he sadvṛkṣa sahasva saṃprati sakhe śākhāśikhākarṣaṇa
analyzed: he sat vṛkṣa sahasva saṃprati sakhe śākhā śikhā ākarṣaṇa
translated: O good tree, now endure, O friend, the pulling of your branches and twigs

original: kṣobhāmoṭanabhañjanāni janataḥ svaireva duścoṣṭitaiḥ //🔽suskandhasya visārisaurabhaguṇākrāntākhilāśasya te
analyzed: kṣobha āmoṭana bhañjanāni janataḥ svaiḥ eva duścoṣṭitaiḥ  su skandhasya visāri saurabha guṇa ākrānta akhila āśasya te
translated: By the people themselves with their own bad actions, such as shaking, twisting and breaking.🔽You whose trunk is good, whose fragrance and qualities pervade all desires,

analyzed: tanvī cāru payodhara antara kṛta sparśasya gopī ākṛteḥ
translated: Whose secret form is created between the slender and beautiful breasts of the cowherdesses,

original: doṣaḥ kopi bhujaṃgasaṃgamakṛtaḥ prodgūta eṣodhunā🔽yena tvāṃ parihṛtya candanataro yāntyadhvagā dūrataḥ //
analyzed: doṣaḥ kaḥ api bhujaṃga saṃgama kṛtaḥ prodgūtaḥ eṣa adhunā  yena tvām parihṛtya candana taraḥ yānti adhvagāḥ dūratas
translated: Some fault has now arisen due to your association with the serpent,🔽By which you are avoided and wayfarers go far away from the sandalwood tree.

analyzed: chinnaḥ tapta suhṛd sa candana taruḥ yūyam palāyya āgatā
translated: That sandalwood tree, the friend in distress, has been cut down, and you have fled away.

analyzed: bhoga abhyāsa sukhāsikāḥ pratidinam tāḥ vismṛtāḥ tatra vaḥ
translated: The pleasures of daily practice with the pleasures of the body, those have been forgotten by you there.

analyzed: daṃṣṭrā koṭi viṣa ulkayā pratikṛtam tasya prahartuḥ na ced
translated: If you do not retaliate with the poison-tipped fangs of that attacker,

original: kiṃ tenaiva saha svayaṃ na nidhanaṃ yātāḥstha bho bhoginaḥ //
analyzed: kim tena eva saha svayam na nidhanam yātāḥ stha bho bhoginaḥ
translated: Why did you not all die together with him, O serpents?

original: tvanmūle puruṣāyuṣaṃ gatamidaṃ kālena saṃśaṣyatāṃ🔽ksodīyāṃsamapi kṣaṇaṃ paramataḥ śaktiḥ kutaḥ prāṇitum /
analyzed: tvad mūle puruṣa āyuṣam gatam idam kālena  ksodīyāṃsam api kṣaṇam param atas śaktiḥ kutas prāṇitum
translated: Having spent this human life at your root, dried up by time,🔽how can there be the power to live even for a moment more, O best of trees?

analyzed: tat svasti astu vivṛddhim ehi mahatīm adya api kā naḥ tvarā
translated: So, may you be well! Grow to greatness now. What hurry do we have?

original: kalyāṇaiḥ phalitāsi tālaviṭapinputreṣu pautreṣu vā //🔽chāyāsyaiva ghanāsugandhirayamevāpannatāpacchidā
analyzed: kalyāṇaiḥ phalitā asi tāla viṭapin putreṣu pautreṣu vā  chāyā asya eva ghana asugandhiḥ ayam eva āpanna tāpa chidā
translated: You have borne fruit through your good deeds, O palm tree, in your sons and grandsons.🔽This very shade, fragrant and dense, is the remover of heat.

analyzed: guṇa grahaḥ sa guṇa tā kim candanasya ucyatām
translated: The quality of being taken up by the mind is in this alone. What is the use of speaking of the qualities of sandalwood?

analyzed: mūlāt punar eṣu baddha vṛtibhiḥ vyālaiḥ tathā
translated: From the root, it is bound again by the coils of the serpent, and thus defiled,

original: jāne yena varaṃ dhavotha khadiropyanyothavā na tvayam //🔽na ślāṣyāni phalāni pallavakṛtā chāyā na vāñchāpi sā
analyzed: jāne yena varam na tu ayam  na ślāṣyāni phalāni pallava kṛtā chāyā na vāñchā api sā
translated: I know that it is better to be a dhavu tree, a khadira tree, or another, but not you.🔽The fruits are not to be praised, nor is there the desired shade from the leaves,

original: no puṣpaṃ sumanoharaṃ na vihagāḥ śabdāmṛtasyandinaḥ /
analyzed: no puṣpam su manoharam na vihagāḥ śabda amṛta syandinaḥ
translated: nor is there the very charming flower, nor are there birds exuding the nectar of their songs.

analyzed: kāka vrāta purīṣa nirbhara jarat mūrteḥ aśuddha ātmanaḥ
translated: The body is filled with the filth of flocks of crows, and the self is impure,

analyzed: niḥstabdhasya taroḥ adhas katham aho sṛṣṭaḥ asi durvedhasā
translated: and the tree is devoid of branches. Alas! You are created under the tree by an evil creator.

original: nāsya svāduphalaṃ na cāru kusumaṃ na snigdhaparṇā latā
analyzed: na asya svādu phalam na cāru kusumam na snigdha parṇā latā
translated: It has no sweet fruit, no beautiful flowers, no glossy leaves,

original: na cchāyā klamahāriṇī na ca kalakvāṇāstathā patriṇaḥ /
analyzed: na chāyā klama hāriṇī na ca kalakvāṇāḥ tathā patriṇaḥ
translated: no shade to dispel fatigue, nor birds with sweet warbling.

analyzed: eṣa asau khadiradumaḥ kim athavā pānthena dṛṣṭaḥ tvayā
translated: Is this a khadira tree that you have seen, O traveler?

original: tatkiṃ pāntha kaṭhorakaṇṭakamukhairgātrakṣatārthī bhavān //🔽snigdhāḥ pallavinaḥ prakāmaviṭapavyāviddhacaṇḍātapā
analyzed: tat kim pāntha kaṭhora kaṇṭaka mukhaiḥ gātra kṣata arthī bhavān  snigdhāḥ pallavinaḥ prakāma viṭapa vyāviddha caṇḍa ātapā
translated: Then, O traveler, do you seek to injure your body with its thorns?🔽The tender leaves are smooth, the thick foliage spreads cool shade,

original: namrāḥ svāduphalā samāśritajanakṣuttāpavicchedinaḥ /🔽dagdhāste taravaḥ prayāntu pathikāsteṣveva mārgeṣvamī
analyzed: dagdhāḥ te taravaḥ prayāntu pathikāḥ teṣu eva mārgeṣu amī
translated: the trees are bent with sweet fruit, to relieve the hunger and thirst of those who depend on them.🔽Those trees have been burnt, and the travelers have gone to other paths.

original: rūkṣāḥ kāṇṭakinaḥ sasarpavivarā bhūyaḥ prarūḍhā drumāḥ //
analyzed: rūkṣāḥ kāṇṭakinaḥ sa sarpa vivarāḥ bhūyas prarūḍhāḥ drumāḥ
translated: The thorny trees have grown again, with holes for snakes.

original: chāyā nātmana eva yā kathamasāvanyasya niṣpragrahā
analyzed: chāyā na ātmanaḥ eva yā katham asau anyasya niṣpragrahā
translated: How can that shade, which belongs to oneself, be controlled by another?

analyzed: grīṣma ūṣma āpadi śītalaḥ tala bhūvi spanda unila ādeḥ kutas
translated: In the calamity of summer heat, where is the cool breeze on the ground?

original: vārtā varṣaśate gate kila phalaṃ bhāvīti vārtaiva sā
analyzed: vārtā varṣa śate gate kila phalam bhāvi iti vārtā eva sā
translated: The news that after a hundred years the fruit will come is just news.

original: drāghimṇā muṣitāḥ kiyacciramaho tālena bālā vayam //
analyzed: drāghimṇā muṣitāḥ kiyat ciram aho tālena bālāḥ vayam
translated: For a long time we have been deceived by the palm tree, O young ones.

original: kastvaṃ bhoḥ kathayāmi daivahatakaṃ māṃ viddhi śāhoṭakaṃ
analyzed: kaḥ tvam bhoḥ kathayāmi daivahatakam mām viddhi śāhoṭakam
translated: Who are you? I say, know me to be a shahutaka, struck by fate.

original: vairāgyādiva vakṣi sādhu viditaṃ kasmādidaṃ kathyate /
analyzed: vairāgyāt iva vakṣi sādhu viditam kasmāt idam kathyate
translated: Why do you speak as if detached? Is it known well? Why is this being told?

analyzed: vāmena atra vaṭaḥ tam adhvaga janaḥ sarva ātmanā sevate
translated: To the left here is a banyan tree, which the travelers serve with their whole being.

original: na cchāyāpi paropakārakṛtaye mārgasthitasyāpi se //🔽āmodairmaruto mṛgāḥ kisalayairlambaistvacā tāpasāḥ
analyzed: na chāyā api para upakāra kṛtaye mārga sthitasya api se  āmodaiḥ marutaḥ mṛgāḥ kisalayaiḥ lambaiḥ tvacā tāpasāḥ
translated: Not even its shade is for the sake of helping others, even for one standing on the path.

analyzed: puṣpaiḥ ṣaṣ caraṇāḥ phalaiḥ śakunayaḥ gharma arditāḥ chāyayā
translated: By its fragrance, the winds; by its long sprouts, the ascetics; by its flowers, the bees; by its fruits, the birds; and by its shade, those afflicted by heat.

analyzed: skandhaiḥ gandha gajāḥ ca viśrama rujāḥ śaśvat vibhaktāḥ tvayā
translated: By its trunk, the fragrant elephants, their pain of exhaustion always relieved by you.

original: prāptastvaṃ druma bodhisattvapadavīṃ satyaṃ kujātāḥ pare //
analyzed: prāptaḥ tvam druma bodhisattva padavīm satyam ku jātāḥ pare
translated: You have attained, O tree, the state of a Bodhisattva. Truly, others are born in vain.

analyzed: bhrāmyat bhṛṅga bhara avanamra kusuma cyotat madhu udgandhiṣu
translated: In the trees, fragrant with the honey dripping from the flowers bent down by the buzzing bees,

analyzed: chāyāvatsu taleṣu pāntha nivahāḥ viśramya geheṣu iva
translated: with their shade like houses, the groups of travelers rest and are refreshed,

analyzed: nityam nirjhara vāri vārita tṛṣaḥ tṛpyanti yeṣām phalaiḥ
translated: their thirst always quenched by the water of the waterfalls and satisfied by your fruits.

original: te nandantu phalantu yāntu ca parāmatyunnatiṃ pādapāḥ //
analyzed: te nandantu phalantu yāntu ca parām ati unnatim pādapāḥ
translated: May those trees rejoice, bear fruit, and attain the highest growth.

original: he he maṇḍitamārga mārgaviṭapiñjīvyāḥ samāḥ śāśvatīr
analyzed: he he maṇḍita mārga mārga viṭa piñjīvyāḥ samāḥ śāśvatīḥ
translated: O you who adorn the path, O trees of the path, live for eternal years.

analyzed: adya api āvṛṇu diś taṭāni viṭapaiḥ sālaiḥ cucumba ambaram
translated: Even now, cover the edges of the directions with your branches, and kiss the sky with your sala trees.

original: mūle viśramaṇāśayaiva luṭhitā yanna tvayā kevalaṃ🔽gharmārteḥ parimocitāḥ phalaśatairyāvadvayaṃ tarpitāḥ //🔽vṛddhiryasya tarormanorathaśatairāśāvatā prārthitā
analyzed: mūle viśramaṇa āśayā eva luṭhitā yat na tvayā kevalam  gharma ārteḥ parimocitāḥ phala śataiḥ yāvat vayam tarpitāḥ  vṛddhiḥ yasya taroḥ manoratha śataiḥ āśāvatā prārthitā
translated: You have not only rolled at the root of the tree with the intention of resting,🔽but have also relieved the suffering from heat and satisfied us with hundreds of fruits.🔽That tree, whose growth was desired with hundreds of hopes by those full of aspiration,

analyzed: jātā asau sarasaḥ pravāsi phala daḥ sarva āśrita apāśrayaḥ
translated: has become a guest for all who depend on it, giving fruits to those who have gone away from the pond.🔽Even though the old bird has obtained an opportunity, it looks from a distance at that tree,

original: nānādeśasamāgatairaviditairākrāntamanyaiḥ khagais🔽taṃ labdhāvasaropi vṛddhaśakunirdūre sthito vīkṣate //
analyzed: nānā deśa samāgataiḥ aviditaiḥ ākrāntam anyaiḥ khagaiḥ  tam labdha avasaraḥ upi vṛddha śakuniḥ dūre sthitaḥ vīkṣate
translated: which is occupied by other birds unknown to it, that have come from various places.

original: dāvāgniploṣaduḥkhaṃ kharapavanajalakleśamarkācca tāpaṃ🔽mātaṅgākarṣaṇāni vyasanamapi guru prāptavantopi vajrāt /
analyzed: dāva agni ploṣa duḥkham khara pavana jala kleśam arkāt ca tāpam  mātaṅga ākarṣaṇāni vyasanam api guru prāptavantaḥ api vajrāt
translated: Even though they have attained the great suffering of being scorched by forest fires, the distress of dry winds and water, and the heat from the sun,🔽and the hardship of being dragged by elephants, the diamonds do not prevent

analyzed: dāru chāyā phalāni tvacam api kusumam mañjarīḥ pallavān vā
translated: the shade of the tree, the fruits, the bark, the flowers, the bunches, the sprouts, or even the leaves

original: nārthibhyo vārayanti pratidivasamaho sādhu vṛttaṃ tarūṇām //🔽haṃsāḥ padmavanāśayā balibhujo gṛdhrāśca māṃsāśayā
analyzed: na arthibhyaḥ vārayanti pratidivasam aho sādhu vṛttam tarūṇām  haṃsāḥ padma vana āśayāḥ balibhujaḥ gṛdhrāḥ ca māṃsa āśayā
translated: from being given to those who ask for them. Oh, the good conduct of the trees every day!🔽The swans with the desire for lotus groves, the vultures for the sake of meat, the bees for the sake of sweet fragrance,

analyzed: pānthāḥ svādu phala āśayāḥ madhulihaḥ saurabhya gandha āśayā
translated: and the travelers with the desire for sweet fruits,

analyzed: dūrāt niṣphala rakta puṣpa nicayaiḥ niḥsāra rathyā unnate
translated: in the empty, high street filled with heaps of fruitless red flowers from afar,

original: re re śalmalipādapa pratidinaṃ ke na tvayā vañcitāḥ //🔽bhrātarbhīmamarubhramśramaśamavyāpārapāraṃgamaṃ
analyzed: re re śalmali pādapa pratidinam ke na tvayā vañcitāḥ  bhrātar bhīma maru bhram śrama śama vyāpāra pāraṃgamam
translated: Oh, oh, Salmali tree! Who have not been deceived by you day after day?

original: matvā candanapādapaṃ pathika mā viśrāntaye śiśriyaḥ /🔽etasyāntikavartibhirghanaviṣajvālāvalībīṣaṇair🔽āśvāsya smṛtiśeṣatāṃ viṣadharairnīṃtaḥ kiyantodhvagāḥ //🔽uccairyo madhupānalubdhamanasāṃ bhṛṅgāṅganānāṃ gaṇair
analyzed: matvā candana pādapam pathika mā viśrāntaye śiśriyaḥ  etasya antika vartibhiḥ ghana viṣa jvālā āvalī bīṣaṇaiḥ  āśvāsya smṛtiśeṣa tām viṣadharaiḥ kiyantaḥ adhvagāḥ  uccais yaḥ madhu pāna lubdha manasām bhṛṅga aṅganānām gaṇaiḥ
translated: Brother, thinking the sandal tree to be skilled in removing the fatigue of the wind, do not resort to it for rest, O traveler.🔽How many travelers have been reduced to mere memory by the poisonous snakes, terrifying with their thick poisonous flames, dwelling near it?

analyzed: udgītaḥ racita ālayaḥ khaga kulaiḥ deśa antarāt āgataiḥ
translated: By the flocks of female bees, their minds greedy for drinking honey, you were sung about loudly, and you became the nesting place for flocks of birds coming from other lands.

analyzed: niṣevitaḥ udhvaga śataiḥ grīṣma ūṣma tānti chide
translated: You were the tree that was resorted to by hundreds of travelers, the destroyer of the heat of summer.

original: soyaṃ saṃprati durmadena dalitaśchāyātarurdantinā //🔽bhuktaṃ svāduphalaṃ kṛtaṃ ca śayanaṃ śākhāgrajaiḥ pallavais
analyzed: saḥ ayam saṃprati durmadena dalitaḥ chāyā taruḥ dantinā  bhuktam svādu phalam kṛtam ca śayanam śākhā agra jaiḥ pallavaiḥ
translated: But now, that tree of shade has been broken by an intoxicated elephant.🔽Sweet fruit has been eaten, a bed has been made with the tender sprouts at the top of the branches,

original: tvacchāyāpariśītalaṃ ca salilaṃ pītaṃ vinītaḥ klamaḥ /
analyzed: tvad chāyā pariśītalam ca salilam pītam vinītaḥ klamaḥ
translated: water has been drunk, cooled by your shade, and fatigue has been relieved.

original: viśrāntaṃ suciraṃ tatopi manasā prāptā parā nirvṛtis
analyzed: viśrāntam su ciram tatas upi manasā prāptā parā nirvṛtiḥ
translated: Having rested for a long time, even greater satisfaction has been attained by the mind.

original: tvaṃ sanmārgatarurvayaṃ ca pathikā bhūyāspunaḥ saṃgamaḥ //
analyzed: tvam sat mārga taruḥ vayam ca pathikāḥ bhūyāḥ punar saṃgamaḥ
translated: You are the tree on the good path, and we are travelers. May there be a reunion again.

original: astyeva bhūbhṛtāṃ mūrdhni divi vā dyotatembudaḥ /
analyzed: asti eva bhūbhṛtām mūrdhni divi vā dyotatā imbudaḥ
translated: The cloud shines on the peak of the mountain or in the sky.

analyzed: marudbhiḥ bhujyamānaḥ upi sa kim eti rasātalam
translated: Even if enjoyed by the Maruts, does it go to the nether world?

analyzed: ambudaḥ kṛta padaḥ nabhastale
translated: The cloud, having reached the sky,

analyzed: toyapūra paripūrita udadhiḥ
translated: the ocean filled with the water it pours,

analyzed: goṣpadasya bharaṇe ipi aśaktimān
translated: is incapable of filling even a cow's hoofprint.

analyzed: iti asatyam abhidīyate katham
translated: How can this be said to be false?🔽Look here, this great lake is drying up,

analyzed: etat atra pathika eka jīvitam  paśya śuṣyati katham mahat saraḥ
translated: the sole life of the traveler in this region.

analyzed: dhik mudhā ambudhara ruddha sat gatiḥ
translated: Fie on the cloud, obstructing the path to heaven in vain,

original: vardhitā kimiha haṭṭavāhinī //🔽svārthānapekṣaṃ janatāpaśāntyai🔽nityoditāḥ santi payomucomī /
analyzed: vardhitā kim iha haṭṭavāhinī  sva artha an apekṣam janatā apaśāntyai  nitya uditāḥ santi payaḥ mucā umī
translated: what has the street-prostitute been increased here?

analyzed: vivarṣiṇaḥ tān avagṛhṇate ye
translated: There are clouds that rise up constantly, without regard for their own interests, to relieve the suffering of the people.

analyzed: santi eva te ke pi mahā anubhāvāḥ
translated: But those who do not let them rain are indeed some very powerful beings.

analyzed: kva dṛṣṭam andhena balāhakena
translated: Where has the blind cloud been seen

analyzed: ghrātum gavā yat na tṛṇam nighṛṣṭam
translated: to graze the grass with its cow?

analyzed: mahā taruḥ bandhuḥ iva adhva gānā
translated: The great tree, like a resting place for travelers,

analyzed: māyā tva vaśyāya kaṇaiḥ daridraḥ  uttuṅga śaila śikhara āśrayaṇena kecid  uddāma vīci valitāḥ saritaḥ bhavanti
translated: is poor in the drops of dew.🔽Some rivers become turbulent with huge waves by resorting to the peaks of high mountains.

analyzed: anye punar jala kaṇāḥ tṛṇa loṣṭa pātā
translated: But other water drops, falling on grass and clods,

analyzed: dambhomucām payasi na kṣayamān puvanti
translated: The clouds do not shower rain in the water of the ocean.

analyzed: yatra uṣitaḥ asi cira kālam akiṃcanaḥ san
translated: Where you have lived for a long time, being poor,

analyzed: na ṛṇaḥ pratigraha dhana grahaṇa adhamarṇaḥ
translated: A debtor, not accepting gifts, the lowest of debtors.

analyzed: nirlajja garjasi samudra taṭe pi tatra
translated: Shameless one, you roar there too on the shore of the ocean.

original: dhṛṣṭodhamastava samo ghana naiva dṛṣṭaḥ //🔽āsyaṃ nirasya rasitaiḥ suciraṃ vihasya
analyzed: dhṛṣṭaḥ adhamaḥ tava samaḥ ghana nā eva dṛṣṭaḥ  āsyam nirasya rasitaiḥ su ciram vihasya
translated: O cloud, a shameless one like you has never been seen.🔽Having covered the mouth with sounds and laughed for a long time,

analyzed: gātra antareṣu ghana varṣasi cātakasya  tad cañcu koṭi kuṭila āyata kaṃdharasya
translated: You pour heavy rain on the part of the Chātaka's body.🔽That is just a joke for you, O cloud, to cause the death of the Chātaka,

analyzed: prāṇa atyayau usya bhavataḥ parihāsa mātram
translated: Whose neck is long and curved like the tip of a beak.

analyzed: ākramya uccais śirasi vasatiḥ bhūbhṛtām unnatānām
translated: Having mounted high on the heads of the lofty kings,

analyzed: toyādānām tat api jaladheḥ loka saṃtāpa śāntyai
translated: And also that of the cloud, for the sake of alleviating the distress of the people.

analyzed: kadrvāḥ prāc prasavaḥ yam atra kupite cintyam yathā idam jagat  trailokya adbhutam īdṛśam tu caritam śoṣasya yena asya sā

translated: When we think of the Malaya mountain itself, which is resorted to by

translated: Those whose crooked ways are made by poison itself, how much is counted

translated: For even a small part of light, overwhelmed by darkness,
